definition: Imperial College (or Academy), the highest educational body in imperial China

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Bianliang Imperial College is a special branch in the central engraving institutions of Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 在宋代中央刻書機構中，汴梁國子監可謂是一枝獨秀。

sentences.english: To deepen understanding of this street, you should know Guozijian and Confucius Temple first.
sentences.chinese: 所以，要了解這條街，就得先知道國子監和孔廟。

sentences.english: The main part of the thesis is divided into five chapters.
sentences.chinese: 第二章主要論述唐代國子監學官的學術素養。

sentences.english: Many institutions in the Imperial Academy in Ytlan Dynasty deeply affected the development of that in Ming and Qing period.
sentences.chinese: 其中的許多制度深刻地影響了明清國子監的發展。

sentences.english: The article expounds the development of the Imperial Academy in Ytlan Dynasty from two different angles.
sentences.chinese: 本文從縱橫兩個角度論述了元代國子監的發展。

sentences.english: The Bianliang Imperial Academy engraving books were mostly engraved and printed in Bianliang.
sentences.chinese: 汴梁國子監刻書大多是在汴梁雕版並印刷的。

definition: Imperial College of Supreme Learning, established in 124 BC, and the highest educational institute in ancient China until the Sui Dynasty
place where the emperor listened to lectures (traditional)
Kaifeng as the capital of Northern Song dynasty
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
scholar preparing for imperial examinations (in former times)
Ministry of Revenue in imperial China
Laizhou county level city in Yantai 煙台|烟台, Shandong
Youyang Tujia and Miao Autonomous County in Chongqing
